docs.lead_paragraph: The high cost of auto insurance, an issue that nearly cost Gov. Christine Todd Whitman of New Jersey her job last year, appears on the verge of becoming a major theme in New York's gubernatorial campaign, with Democrats blaming Gov. George E. Pataki for high rates. Now that New Jersey has mandated a 15 percent cut in rates, New York is about to overtake its neighbor as the state with the nation's highest auto insurance premiums, having risen from sixth place in 1993. Some Democratic strategists say that New York's dubious new ranking could help give the issue the same political potency here that it proved to have last year in New Jersey.

headline.main: Pataki's Foes Act to Exploit Insurance Issue

docs.abstract: High cost of auto insurance appears on verge of becoming major theme in New York's gubernatorial campaign, with Democrats blaming Gov George E Pataki for high rates; New York is about to overtake New Jersey as state with nation's highest auto insurance premiums, having risen from sixth place in 1993; Democratic strategists in New York hope state's dubious new ranking will give issue same political potency that it had last year in New Jersey; Peter F Vallone and Lt Gov Betsy McCaughey Ross, front-runners in race for Democratic gubernatorial nomination, will offer their own plans for lowering rates; report released by majority Democrats in State Assembly says rates, and insurance company profits, rose much faster in New York than in nation as whole during 1990's, and blames Pataki, whose administration has approved each rate increase (M)
docs.snippet: The high cost of auto insurance, an issue that nearly cost Gov. Christine Todd Whitman of New Jersey her job last year, appears on the verge of becoming a major theme in New York's gubernatorial campaign, with Democrats blaming Gov. George E. Pataki...
